snippet: While a horrific gang rape in New Delhi has drawn attention to a violent epidemic, rape is just one facet of a broad range of violence that leads to the deaths of almost two million women a year.
abstract: Researchers say rape in India is just one facet of violence and discrimination that leads to deaths of almost two million women per year; while horrific gang rape in New Delhi has drawn attention to violent epidemic, women are also routinely subjected to domestic violence, and there are high rates of female infanticide, as well as infant neglect and poor care for elderly that affects women and girls far more than men and boys.
lead_paragraph: While a horrific gang rape in New Delhi has drawn attention to a violent epidemic, rape is just one facet of a broad range of violence that leads to the deaths of almost two million women a year.

headline.seo: In Rape’s Aftermath, India Debates Violence Against Women
headline.main: India’s New Focus on Rape Shows Only the Surface of Women’s Perils
headline.print_headline: India’s New Focus on Rape Shows Only the Surface of Women’s Perils
